001package imagingbook.lib.util;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
004import java.io.PrintStream;
005import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
006import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
007import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
008import java.lang.annotation.Target;
009import java.lang.reflect.Field;
010import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
011
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013
014/**
015 * Interface to be implemented by local 'Parameters' classes.
016 * This is part of the 'simple parameter object' scheme,
017 * working with public fields.
018 * Only non-static, non-final, public fields are accepted as parameters.
019 * 
020 * Current features:
021 * (a) Makes parameter bundles printable by listing all eligible fields.
022 * (b) Parameter bundles can be added/modified as a whole by ImageJ's 
023 * {@link GenericDialog}, supported by specific annotations.
024 * 
025 * Other functionality may be added in the future.
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/02/02
029 */
030public interface ParameterBundle {
031        
032        public default String printToString() {
033                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
034                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
035                        printToStream(strm);
036                }
037                return bas.toString();
038        }
039
040        public default void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
041                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
042                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
043                strm.println(clazz.getCanonicalName());
044                for (Field field : fields) {
045                        if (!isValidParameterItem(field)) {
046                                continue;
047                        }
048                        strm.print(field.getType().getSimpleName() + " ");
049                        strm.print(field.getName() + " = ");
050                        try {
051                                strm.print(field.get(this).toString());
052                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }       
053                        strm.println();
054//                      int modifiers = field.getModifiers();
055//                      strm.println("Field is public = " + Modifier.isPublic(modifiers));
056//                      strm.println("Field is final = " + Modifier.isFinal(modifiers));
057                }
058        }
059        
060        // ---- Dialog-related annotations to be used on individual parameter fields ------
061        
062        
063        /**
064         * Annotation to specify a specific 'label' to be shown for following
065         * parameter fields. Default label is the variable name.
066         */
067        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
068        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
069        public @interface DialogLabel {
070                public String value();
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Annotation to specify the number of digits displayed when showing
075         * numeric values in dialogs.
076         * This annotation has no effect on non-floating-point fields.
077         */
078        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
079        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
080        public @interface DialogDigits {
081                public int value();
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Annotation to always hide the following parameter field in dialogs.
086         */
087        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
088        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
089        public @interface DialogHide {
090        }
091        
092        // ------------ ImageJ dialog-related (move to another interface?) ------------------
093        
094        public default void addToDialog(GenericDialog gd) {
095                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
096                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
097                for (Field f : fields) {
098                        if (!isValidParameterItem(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
099                                continue;
100                        }
101                        try {
102                                addFieldToDialog(f, gd);
103                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
104                }
105        }
106        
107        public default boolean getFromDialog(GenericDialog gd) {
108                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
109                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
110                int errorCount = 0;
111                for (Field f : fields) {
112                        if (!isValidParameterItem(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
113                                continue;
114                        }
115                        try {
116                                if (!getFieldFromDialog(f, gd)) {
117                                        errorCount++;
118                                }
119                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
120                }
121                return (errorCount == 0);
122        }
123        
124        static boolean isValidParameterItem(Field f) {
125                int mod = f.getModifiers();
126                if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
127                        return false;
128                }
129                return true;
130        }
131        
132        static void printModifiers(Field f) {
133                int mod = f.getModifiers();
134                System.out.println("Modifiers of field " + f.getName());
135                System.out.println("abstract     = " + Modifier.isAbstract(mod));
136                System.out.println("final        = " + Modifier.isFinal(mod));
137                System.out.println("interface    = " + Modifier.isInterface(mod));
138                System.out.println("native       = " + Modifier.isNative(mod));
139                System.out.println("private      = " + Modifier.isPrivate(mod));
140                System.out.println("protected    = " + Modifier.isProtected(mod));
141                System.out.println("public       = " + Modifier.isPublic(mod));
142                System.out.println("static       = " + Modifier.isStatic(mod));
143                System.out.println("strict       = " + Modifier.isStrict(mod));
144                System.out.println("synchronized = " + Modifier.isSynchronized(mod));
145                System.out.println("transient    = " + Modifier.isTransient(mod));
146                System.out.println("volatite     = " + Modifier.isVolatile(mod));
147                
148                
149        }
150        
151        /**
152         * Adds the specified {@link Field} of this object as new item to 
153         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
154         * The name of the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item.
155         * TODO: this could/should be private!
156         * 
157         * @param field some field
158         * @param dialog the dialog
159         * @throws IllegalAccessException when field is accessed illegally
160         */
161        default void addFieldToDialog(Field field, GenericDialog dialog) 
162                        throws IllegalAccessException {
163                
164                String name = field.getName();
165                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogLabel.class)) {
166                        name = field.getAnnotation(DialogLabel.class).value();
167                }
168                
169                int digits = 2; // DefaultDialogDigits;
170                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogDigits.class)) {
171                        digits = field.getAnnotation(DialogDigits.class).value();
172                        digits = Math.max(0,  digits);
173                }
174                
175                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
176                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
177                        dialog.addCheckbox(name, field.getBoolean(this));
178                }
179                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
180                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getInt(this), 0);
181                }
182                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
183                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getFloat(this), digits);
184                }
185                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
186                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getDouble(this), digits);
187                }
188                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
189                        String str = (String) field.get(this);
190                        dialog.addStringField(name, str);
191                }
192                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
193                        dialog.addEnumChoice(name, (Enum<?>) field.get(this));
194                }
195                else {
196                        throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
197                }
198        }
199
200        /**
201         * Modifies the specified {@link Field} of this object by reading the next item
202         * from the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
203         * TODO: this could/should be private!
204         * 
205         * @param field a publicly accessible {@link Field} of this object 
206         * @param dialog a {@link GenericDialog} instance
207         * @return true if successful
208         * @throws IllegalAccessException illegal field access
209         */
210        @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
211        default boolean getFieldFromDialog(Field field, GenericDialog dialog) 
212                                        throws IllegalAccessException {
213                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
214                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
215                        field.setBoolean(this, dialog.getNextBoolean());
216                }
217                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
218                        double val = dialog.getNextNumber();
219                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
220                                return false;
221                        }
222                        field.setInt(this, (int) val);
223                }
224                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
225                        double val = dialog.getNextNumber();
226                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
227                                return false;
228                        }
229                        field.setFloat(this, (float) val);
230                }
231                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
232                        double val = dialog.getNextNumber();
233                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
234                                return false;
235                        }
236                        field.setDouble(this, val);
237                }
238                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
239                        String str = dialog.getNextString();
240                        if (str == null) {
241                                return false;
242                        }
243                        field.set(this, str);
244                }
245                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
246                        Enum en = dialog.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz);
247                        if (en == null) {
248                                return false;
249                        }
250                        field.set(this, en);
251//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<? extends Enum>) clazz));       // works                        
252//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz)); // works        
253                }
254                else {
255                        throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
256                }
257                return true;
258        }
259        
260        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
261        
262        enum MyEnum {
263                A, B, Cee
264        }
265
266        // Example parameter bundle
267        static class DemoParameters implements ParameterBundle {
268                public static int staticInt = 44;       // currently static members are listed too!
269                
270                @DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
271                public boolean someBool = true;
272                public int someInt = 39;
273                public float someFloat = 1.99f;
274                
275                @DialogLabel("Math.PI")@DialogDigits(10)
276                public double someDouble = Math.PI;
277                public String someString = "SHOW ME";
278                
279                @DialogHide
280                public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
281                public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
282        }
283        
284        public static void main(String[] args) {
285                
286                ParameterBundle params = new DemoParameters();
287                System.out.println("p1 = \n" + params.printToString());
288                
289                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(ParameterBundle.class.getSimpleName());
290                gd.addNumericField("some single int", 123, 0);
291                params.addToDialog(gd);
292                
293                gd.showDialog();
294                if (gd.wasCanceled())
295                        return;
296                
297                @SuppressWarnings("unused")
298                int singleInt = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
299                boolean success = params.getFromDialog(gd);
300                System.out.println("success = " + success);
301                System.out.println("p2 = \n" + params.printToString());
302        }
303        
304}
